definition: the act of dragging (pulling with force), proceed for an extended period of time
details:
noun
- the act of dragging (pulling with force)
= example: the act of dragging (pulling with force)
- a slow inhalation (as of tobacco smoke)
= synonyms: pull
- clothing that is conventionally worn by the opposite sex: especially women's clothing when worn by a man
= example: clothing that is conventionally worn by the opposite sex: especially women's clothing when worn by a man
- something tedious and boring
= example: something tedious and boring
- something that slows or delays progress
= example: something that slows or delays progress
- the phenomenon of resistance to motion through a fluid
= synonyms: retarding force
verb
- proceed for an extended period of time
= example: proceed for an extended period of time
= synonyms: drag on
- persuade to come away from something attractive or interesting
= example: persuade to come away from something attractive or interesting
- suck in or take (air)
= synonyms: draw, puff
- search (as the bottom of a body of water) for something valuable or lost
= synonyms: dredge
- pull, as against a resistance
= example: pull, as against a resistance
- draw slowly or heavily
= synonyms: haul
- walk without lifting the feet
= synonyms: scuff
- to lag or linger behind
= example: to lag or linger behind
= synonyms: trail
- move slowly and as if with great effort
- use a computer mouse to move icons on the screen and select commands from a menu
= example: use a computer mouse to move icons on the screen and select commands from a menu
- force into some kind of situation, condition, or course of action
= synonyms: sweep, tangle, sweep up, embroil, drag in
